thread.title: Chalk Talk: Maggard talks Auburn game
thread.title_full: Chalk Talk: Maggard talks Auburn game

title: Chalk Talk: Maggard talks Auburn game
text:
/ Article 
LEXINGTON, Ky. (WYMT) -- Kentucky (4-1) will play Auburn (3-2) Thursday night inside Commonwealth Stadium at 7:00 p.m. 
Both teams come off an open week, and after Mark Stoops' presser Monday, Freddie Maggard believes the biggest concern is defensive tackle Cory Johnson's status. 
"Mainly that Cory Johnson got rolled up in practice, his status is questionable," Maggard said. "I think that really hurts UK because a player like CJ is disruptive, and can be active in the offensive line and give me penetration across the line of scrimmage, because Mark Stoops and all the coaches talked about that next man up menatlity. Boom Williams is back starting at running back we can put that behind us, and really talked about finishing and being consistent, and things that Kentucky needs to string together for four quarters to beat a very, very talented Auburn team." 
To hear more, check out this week's episode of "Chalk Talk."
